channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Zephyr Project Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Zephyr Project Manager

item.title: CVE-2022-2840|2024-08-03T00:52:59.448Z -- unknown -- zephyr%20project%20manager
item.description: The Zephyr Project Manager WordPress plugin before 3.2.5 does not sanitise and escape various parameters before using them in SQL statements via various AJAX actions available to both unauthenticated and authenticated users, leading to SQL injections

item.title: CVE-2022-2839|2024-08-03T00:52:59.468Z -- unknown -- zephyr%20project%20manager
item.description: The Zephyr Project Manager WordPress plugin before 3.2.55 does not have any authorisation as well as CSRF in all its AJAX actions, allowing unauthenticated users to call them either directly or via CSRF attacks. Furthermore, due to the lack of sanitisation and escaping, it could also allow them to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks against logged in admins.

item.title: CVE-2024-6536|2024-07-30T14:05:31.987Z -- unknown -- zephyr%20project%20manager
item.description: The Zephyr Project Manager WordPress plugin before 3.3.99 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editors and admins to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-6536|2024-07-30T06:00:10.760Z -- unknown -- zephyr%20project%20manager
item.description: The Zephyr Project Manager WordPress plugin before 3.3.99 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editors and admins to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-6536|2024-08-01T21:41:03.512Z -- unknown -- zephyr%20project%20manager
item.description: The Zephyr Project Manager WordPress plugin before 3.3.99 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editors and admins to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)
